page.title: 09A WALK THROUGH BERE FERRERS
page.content: We came out of the un-manned station that is being converted into holiday flats and the station-master's house that is also a holiday home and we were in the top of the village where houses are newer and one was being built - a bungalow made of granite blocks. There was a concrete mixer and a wheelbarrow with cement. We met and interviewed some people who were going to the station. One lady goes shopping to Plymouth twice a week, another, who goes on the train once a month, has lived in Bere Ferrers for thirty years. We came to the village pump which still works and is used.We saw anotice saying "Fresh Eggs for Sale." There were other notices about village events.We passed the lovely church and a hotel.The Post Office and shop are near the quay where we had a picnic.
